sit
You're already sitting.
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
move
The starship is already moving.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

l move
the two-person hardened asteroid hauler "Move Along"
You see a scout here.
"Move Along" is written along its hull in blocky silver letters.
The designation "CMX-303-AS" is stamped in tiny letters near its landing struts.
This starship advertises its function with its form. It does not look
particularly flightworthy, with protruding turrets, communications equipment,
and a box-like protrusion in the rear where the reactionless drive and wormhole
drive reside. But, of course, it is not intended to fly through an atmosphere. A
small protrusion on the nose of the vessel is its main sensor relay. Only the
bottom appears smooth, and even that is marred by the extension of its landing
struts when not in flight.
The hull is faded and slightly scorched and painted a deep green color with
silver trim. Its laser turrets are sleek and dangerous-looking and outlined in
silver. The bays of its torpedo launchers are oiled to perfection and painted
silver. Its landing struts are slightly rusty and painted gunmetal grey.
It has an AEU logo on the port side, a pair of plastic testicles on the forward
end, and a complicated anchor assembly on the underside.
transport move
The two-person hardened asteroid hauler "Move Along" is loaded onto an automated
flatbed and slowly moved into a large garage.

l phone
a metallic gold touch einrophone
This is an Einstein-Rosen telephone. It has a clever touch screen, saving your
fingertips from the wear and tear that comes with pressing buttons on a keypad.
This phone has a Full Service plan with Caller ID, Message Board Reader,
Temporary Space Station Reference, and Newsreader.
It is not currently connected to anyone.
A metallic gold touch einrophone also reports that there are unread messages in
OOC/Comedy, OOC/Messages To The Staff, and General/Name Changes.

You remove a metallic gold touch einrophone from a black leather phone holster.
Enter a contact, 00 for directory assistance, or enter nothing in order to see a

tony's
You tap a number into a metallic gold touch einrophone.
The ringing stops as the other end is picked up.
Over the line, you hear a gruff man say, "Tony's House o' Wings."
'Hello
You say, "Hello."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man ask, "First time ordering? We have WINGS!
Also shrimp, burgers, and hot dogs. You can add a side of chili cheese fries,
cheese fries, fries, onion rings, cheese sticks, and jalapeno poppers. And for
beverages, orange soda, lemon-lime soda, cherry soda, dark cola, and cola. What
can we get you?"
'Burger
You say, "Burger."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man say, "Okay, what kind? We have chicken,
bacon, cheese, and devil."
'bacon
You say, "Bacon."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man say, "Okay, that's an order of a half-pound
bacon cheeseburger."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man ask, "Anything else?"
'chili cheese fries
You say, "Chili cheese fries."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man say, "Okay, that's one chili cheese fries."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man ask, "Anything else?"
'orange soda
You say, "Orange soda."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man say, "Okay, that's one orange soda."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man ask, "Anything else?"
'no, that'll be all
You say, "No, that'll be all."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man ask, "Okay, where are we delivering to?"
'Israel Hope
You say, "Israel Hope."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man ask, "Huh? Where?"
'New Earth Lounge
You say, "New Earth Lounge."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man say, "New Earth then, right, got it."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man say, "Okay, that's 25.00 League credits for
the food, plus the 10,000 credit delivery fee. Hang on one sec."
Over the line, you hear a gruff man say, "Okay, you're all set. We'll be there
in a few minutes."
The connection goes silent with a soft click.
You place a metallic gold touch einrophone into a black leather phone holster.
out
You scramble to your feet.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The eight-person soothsayer Mark Two "Creature Of The Night" and the five-person
A.S.S. tactical platform "Israel Hope" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a small trash can, and a sanitation drone
here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "Come on, we
can reach our performance goals if we try!"

i
 You are wearing a casually loose-fitting black t-shirt with a bright red dragon
embroidered on the front, a pair of relaxed fit light khaki cargo pants, and a
pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a
pair of white cotton briefs and a pair of black socks. You are also wearing a
keychain, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a
gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator,
a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a backpack. You are concealing a
flight control scanner, a leather briefcase, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling
supply kit, a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, a black flightbag
with a red shooting star on the side, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black
engineering tool case, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, and a
scorched metal thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows,
both forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying a white foam box in your right hand, and a bright orange
package in your left hand.

l
[Starship "Celestial Explorer"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

[Chetumal Spaceport; Pilot Lounge]
Sheets of tinted glass form a transparent window into the outside world around
this crescent-shaped lounge, giving you a clear view to both the landing pad and
the surrounding mountains and other Chetumalian scenery. Comfortable couches are
spaced in neat clusters for pilots to sit in as they socialize and are brought
refreshments by the attractive waitresses. Scattered close to the groups of
couches are multiple holovids tuned to the latest news, captions scrolling
around the edges. A stairway towards the back of the room has its door open and
bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a gleaming granite-topped bar, a public holovid, and a brightly-lit
candy vending machine here.

[Teslatown; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The landing pad, like all exterior portions of the facility, is covered with a
giant Faraday cage which keeps out the electrical blasts that are hurled down
from the sky on a regular basis. To stand in when the cage is opened, such as
when a starship is departing or arriving, a number of tall lightning rods
surround the pad, each attached to a drooping grounding wire that buries itself
in the ground.
The two-person Accord gemini "Sg 8", the four-person mule "ShadowHawk", the

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
purple photocopier, an insulated green cooler, Purr the humanoid service robot,
a clear plastic food storage container, Jewel the large violet glowing felo, and
Xavier the big silver soldier felo here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.

a compact red refrigerator
This compact red refrigerator is made tall and narrow to fit into the often
cramped spaces aboard a starship or space station. Because of its excellent
insulation, food and drink stored in it will not spoil.
It is open.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 10
Module Transports:
Four-Person Accord Space Module Transport 20000000.00 (AFW Command)
AFW SPACE MODULE TRANSPORT
Class: Light cruiser
Requirements: 20 industry points      0 combat points
Model number: AFW-063                   Designation: Accord Space Module
Transport
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 12000        Standard battery hours: 18
Docking bay size required: 160
This ship will allow you to move around temporary space station modules and
position them properly so that you can create a temporary space structure in the
sector of your choice. Despite being a light cruiser, this vessel does not have
a docking bay, replacing the dockin bay with the module bay. It can hold up to
28 temporary space station modules.
Two-Person Accord Space Module Scout 20,000,000.00 (AFW Command)
AFW SPACE MODULE SCOUT
Class: Scout
Requirements: 20 industry points        300 exploration points
Model number: AFW-071                   Designation: Accord Space Module Scout
Turret hardpoints: 2                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 4000         Standard battery hours: 20
Docking bay size required: 60
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 110%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 110%
This ship, though smaller than its cousin and able to fit only seven temporary
space station modules has two hours more charge, and also has an exploration
point requirement. Even with this exploration point requirement however, it does
not seem like this ship has exploration-grade sensors, and cannot be fitted with
an impeller upgrade.
AC-2X SPACE CONSTRUCTOR 100,000,000.00 (Aenea)
Class: Light cruiser
Requirements: 2500 industry points
Model number: AC-2X                     Designation: Space Constructor
Turret hardpoints: 4                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 10000        Standard battery hours: 12
Docking bay size required: 225
This vessel is able to hold 28 temporary space station modules, just like the
module transport. However, this particular design which is currently only
available to the AEU, has the added benefits of not needing space lifters at all
for temporary station construction. This is because you can construct the
temporary stations from inside the docking bay, and thenjust push the station
itself out when you need to. It appears that you can have more than one
temporary station constructed and ready for deployment in the module bay at any
given time, but the modules used in the construction will still count towards
the module bay's total limit.
[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "Looks like
we've got some things going, but we haven't met any performance goals yet!"

ftl accord
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.

l
[Starship "Shooting Star"; Control Capsule]
This small capsule is only large enough for one person. A single flight seat
molds itself to the form of its occupant, helping to ease the burden of
acceleration along with a rather underpowered artificial gravity dampening
system. The capsule's inner workings extend into the flight cabin, with the
starship's main computer right up against the back of the seat. A rather sparse
flight control board is presented claustrophobically close to the pilot's face.
It seems to lack any sort of manual control, allowing only automatic flight
profiles to be entered into an antiquated flight computer. It does, however,
possess controls to operate a single small turret. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is in space. The hatch appears to be locked.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go nowhere.
(You are sitting.)
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

l
[Starship "Chemeketa"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Endymion Spaceport; Landing Pad.
You see Shule Elemmire's workbench here.
You can go up and out.
You stand before Shule Elemmire's workbench and gather various supplies, then
skillfully assemble them into a starship timekeeping display.
(30 seconds roundtime.)

launch

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Chemeketa!
Welcome to home space!"

l
[Starship "Chemeketa"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go up and out.
Would you like to request landing clearance at New Earth?
[Enter `yes' or `no']

There are no ships in range.

transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.

[The Torus; Dock Delta]
The silver-colored walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay
glow with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it also
somehow retains its atmosphere. Outside, against the starry expanse of distant
space, you can see the bright glint of a solitary blue-white star. A doorway to
the east has been sealed, with a sign beside it reading, 'Transport Service -
Torus Circuit. CLOSED UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.' The Torus starship store is to the
west.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.

Squidsoft.Net InterMOO Message Board System
--
Subject: Bruises...a suggestion
Author: usfolks
Posted: Mon Aug  1 16:14:42 2016 UTC
--
So...In many ways SC attempts to make things quite realistic, offering us
showers (even though we don't get body odor...bummer!). This includes injuries.
Most injuries act the way that real-world injuries do. If a bone is broken, it's
hard to move the appendage. If you have a concussion you get a little wonky in
the head. However...in the real world, some injuries (like bruises) do heal
naturally on their own with absolutely no medical intervention. Almost 3 weeks
ago, my chraracter received a love tap from a friend's friendly little felo. The
bruise is still there. In the real world, this bruise would have changed by
now...faded at least, if not disappeared completely.
So, here is my suggestion. Food is dated in the code...day old food shows that
in the description. I would assume that given this technique is used for food
descriptions, it wouldn't be too terribly hard to figure out something for
bruises, where after a week (for example), it would begin to fade. Maybe I'm
oversimplifying it in my head, as I don't know much at all about MOOCode,
so...just curious then...how hard would this be to do?
As an aside, I wouldn't expect broken bones, concussions, or other injuries to
fade over time, often they get worse without medical intervention. The same can
be said for cuts and gashes. However, very rarely do bruises stay around for
such an extended period of time with no change.
Also, I admit that there may be a reason for this being coded the way it is, so
if so, I'm curious and would love to know.
Thanks for listening!
--
[1] Next
[2] Previous
[3] Return
[4] Reply
[5] Quit
--
Enter your selection:
1
--
Squidsoft.Net InterMOO Message Board System
--
Subject: Re: Bruises...a suggestion
Author: atherj
Posted: Mon Aug  1 20:57:50 2016 UTC
--
Actually, I have wanted to see changes to the medical system and am fairly sure
I've said so in the past in some way or other. Aside from bruises not healing
themselves, currently as far as I'm aware, there are no penalties when someone
operates a starship with any sort of injurry. That would definitely be something
I would want to see change. From additional roundtime in performing ship
commands, to being unable to do certain things at all.
I would also imagine this kind of thing to include battlesuit operations, as
well. Often times, and yes, I've been guilty of this before, I have gotten back
into a ground combat mission in the past without even bothering to heal, and
operated my battlesuit as normally as could be. That was probably my own poor
roleplay though, which I would like to think I have since refined.
Lastly, what I've always wanted to see are injurries to other body parts, as
well as different types of injurries. Right now, there are pretty much only
blunt force injurries, and injurries only to one's four limbs and head.
Of course, all of this will most likely require a full recoding of the medical
system, which is probably as old as the game itself. I'm sure that the hosts
have other more relevant things to do at the moment! So, it's probably low on
the priority list.
--

[2] Previous

shell and four small claws for Trade

and four small claws to trade for anything other than red or yellow. Please drop
a note in the mail to me if you have a differend colored Snapper egg to trade.

A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.

reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
(Q9d]Lo`mjX9=u'{'SL,3]3V44QkoH=@@Eh3+:;H
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Kalliste.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

salvage from the wrecks.

ftl accord
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
Via general sector communication, Accord of Free Worlds Command transmits,
"Hello, Kalliste. Welcome to Accord space."

from the various starship systems.

Which sector did you mean?
[1] The Shoulder of Orion (Unclaimed)
[2] The Belt of Orion (Unclaimed)
Enter your selection:
2
You stumble, then fall heavily to the floor.
(3 seconds roundtime.)
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
vt{6aH8L?o{5kV{uho,?s|8n_LNe.x%H!CtB7[*{
sit chair
You sit up onto a gray leather captain's chair.
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Kalliste.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Kalliste!
Welcome to home space!"

[New Earth Ship Sales; Salvage Recovery Tools]
As customers and curious tourists enter this store, they inevitably instantly
glance up to observe the massive life-sized salvage recovery grapple suspended
along the ceiling. In one corner of the room, a demonstration electromagnetic
manipulator holds a metal sphere suspended in the air. A few people try to break
the EMM's grip, but they are unable to even budge the sphere.
You can go north.

[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
Even though this starship garage smells like machine oil and heavy lubricants,
it is spacious and well-lit. Massive hydraulic systems raise and lower starships
to and from the landing pad above, and technicians and mechanics in silvery gray
coveralls ensure that everything keeps running smoothly. A well-lit stairway
which leads to the pilot's lounge is here.
You can go up.

with a red shooting star on the side, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black
engineering tool case, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, and a
scorched metal thigh holster. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows,
both forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.
l
[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
Even though this starship garage smells like machine oil and heavy lubricants,
it is spacious and well-lit. Massive hydraulic systems raise and lower starships
to and from the landing pad above, and technicians and mechanics in silvery gray
coveralls ensure that everything keeps running smoothly. A well-lit stairway
which leads to the pilot's lounge is here.
You can go up.

[Starship "Triple Action Faction!"; Weapons Room]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. The status lights
overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in a garage.
You can go down.

[Starship "Triple Trouble"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You see a swiveling black leather gunner's chair with a sleeping obese dark
violet sabre-toothed felo on it, an improved temporary wormhole drive, a crudely
hammered scrap metal feeding trough, a felo nest, and a large black
sabre-toothed felo kitten here.
You can go north and down.

l
[Starship "Triple Trouble"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair with a sleeping obese black
sabre-toothed felo kitten on it, a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive
tracer, a small natural golden brown trash bin, a transparisteel plaque engraved
with the phrase "The felo on this ship are not friendly and will bite! Pet at
your own risk!", a manual zero-point energy receptacle charger, a glossy indigo
ceramic felo chow bowl, a large black sabre-toothed felo, a large violet
sabre-toothed felo kitten, and a hefty black ridged felo here.
You can go south, up, and out.

l kitten
a large violet sabre-toothed felo kitten
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely cat-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, tabby violet fur,
possessing a short, crooked tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
long, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with average, curved brown claws
visible. A violet, diamond nose sits below a pair of bright blue eyes with
horizontal pupils. A pair of vicious sabre-tooth fangs protrude from its mouth.

ftl hyperion
The computer reports that the scout "AEU Navy Honour Guard Scout Chi-6" has
jumped out of the sector.
A single star shines brightly in the dark here, the light strangely comforting.
The ship's sensors indicate that the star's spectrum is nearly identical to
Sol's.
Hyperion's famous Sea of Grass is immediately obvious upon gazing at the planet,
the rolling, meters-deep expanse of tall grasses obscuring the contours of the
surface.

[Hyperion; Trading Center]
The trading center seems to be one of the busiest places in the spaceport. Which
is not surprising, considering the profits that successful trading can bring in.
Avoiding the automated computer terminals used by the career traders, you decide
to approach a human trade clerk. This, incidentally, will also subject your
purchases and sales to less scrutiny.

Squidsoft.Net InterMOO Message Board System
--
Subject: Re: Bruises...a suggestion
Author: usfolks
Posted: Tue Aug  2 00:11:11 2016 UTC
--
I suppose my character has never been injured enough (other than possibly once,
and that was when barely even a cadet) to have a situation where roundtime for
injuries he sustained would be relevant. I thought I had read there was
roundtime with broken bones and concussions, at least. What may have helped this
assumption along is another player's good RP when their character had a broken
arm...dropping things occasionally. I figured that was coded and I guess should
have given the player more credit. But...I didn't know.
That being said, I can see this being low on the priorities list, but would echo
what has been said. It would also be nice to, at some point, (something my
character has no problem with keeping up with himself), feel hunger pangs, etc.
Our eating can encourage roleplay, and I must admit, as a *very* new player, I
didn't see that right away.
Forgive me if I'm rambling, I literally just woke up within about 2 minutes of
writing this!...ok, so...what I wanted to add: I hesitated to suggest this, as I
can see it being abused somehow, but in theory, it would be nice for there to be
a penalty for not seeking medical attention for certain types of injures that
lasted past the time when you finally came to your senses and got into a creche.
For example, if you wait a week to treat a broken arm, that arm would always be
stiff and not quite work right. Because I admit that I know little about
MOOCode, I don't know how feasible this would be...also, I can see people using
it to really screw with their characters in a way that could be detrimental to
the game.
Keep an eye out for more things I've thought about, some that may or may not be
popular...we'll see. I enjoy SC thoroughly and want to be a asset to it to the
best of my ability, and...well...I think too much sometimes!
--

Subject: Re: Bruises...a suggestion
Author: atherj
Posted: Tue Aug  2 00:13:45 2016 UTC
--
Oh, there are such penalties around, to be sure. You do drop stuff when you have
broken arms, and you do get roundtime when you walk around on a broken leg or
legs. That being said, my message was specifically geared towards starships and
battlesuits, not the penalties that already exist and should continue to exist.

Your communicator also reports that there are 5 pilots who were active but

have not recently been active.
Final total: 25 pilots.
Want to know if anyone's relaxing in a public venue? Check WHERE!
Lily Kaise speaks into her metachannel FTL communicator:
[Tactical Communication] Lily Kaise transmits, "Oh Missions? Yeah I would like
them."
Lily Kaise laughs.
laugh
You laugh.
tra tac Need at least 3 more.
[Tactical Communication] Shule Elemmire transmits, "Need at least 3 more."
'Nope, guess not
You say, "Nope, guess not."
'I'm not sure how many are still at NQ.
You say, "I'm not sure how many are still at NQ."
A large semi-transparent cylindrical creature with long dangling tendrils and a
green glowing interior drifts slowly across the tank.
'I know at least Damien ist still heading back.
You say, "I know at least Damien ist still heading back."
Lily Kaise nods.
wrap lily
You wrap your arms around Lily Kaise, pulling her close.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Surprised they were still there. Most
jsut hang around a day or so. Makes me wonder if there's anythingnew there."
nod
You nod.
cuddle lily
You cuddle up to Lily Kaise.
wrap lily
You wrap your arms around Lily Kaise, pulling her close.
kiss lily on lips
You kiss Lily Kaise on the lips.
Lily Kaise wraps her arms around you, pulling you close.
-lily I'm sorry babe. I know you want to get those SCP.
You say to Lily, "I'm sorry babe. I know you want to get those SCP."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Oh it's ok. It will happen in time."
nod
You nod.
Lily Kaise asks in a New Earth accent, "Ok then want to go to Old Frontier and
of course check Glittering on the way?"
smile 'Sure.
You smile. "Sure."
Lily Kaise grins.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Sec want to look for a lizie."
Lily Kaise stands up from a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made
white and sapphire star quilt on it.
'ok
You say, "Ok."
Lily Kaise glides south.
peer s
You peer south...
[Starship "William Dove"; Base Block]
The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through
the windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a soft round ocean blue rug with a design of coral and turquoise
seashells, a blueberry rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered
cushion on it, a round white rattan dining table with a glass top, a blueberry
rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered cushion on it, a rattan
floor lamp with a coral lotus shade, a small dusky pink trash bin, a blueberry
rattan pantry cabinet, a white microwave oven, a small purple ball containing a
dingling bell, a glossy slate blue ceramic felo chow bowl, and Samantha the
large violet felo here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.
Lily Kaise glides in from the south.
smile lily
You smile at Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise says to you in a New Earth accent, "Sorry was sorting out fish and
corpses and lovely things like that."
Lily Kaise laughs.
'No problem
You say, "No problem."
Lily Kaise grasps a large lever on the control board and pushes it slowly away
from her.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
hug lily
You hug Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise uses the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
kiss lily
You kiss Lily Kaise.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "William Dove, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
Lily Kaise kisses you.
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
This asteroid belt is unusually close to its star, and the slowly rotating
asteroids glitter brightly in the sunlight.
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
Via general sector communication, Space Station Delta transmits, "Hello there,
William Dove! Welcome to home space!"
The computer reports that the two-person light transport "Registered Merchant
014" has docked with Space Station Delta.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Asteroid Belt
Management Station.
gen 4
Via general sector communication, this ship transmits a standard signal: "Where
are you bound?"
'oh, they jumped out
You say, "Oh, they jumped out."
Lily Kaise nods.
chuckle
You chuckle.
Lily Kaise laughs.
laugh
You laugh.
Lily Kaise begins the docking sequence.
stand
You stand up from a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.
wrap lily
You wrap your arms around Lily Kaise, pulling her close.
Lily Kaise wraps her arms around you, pulling you close.
Lily Kaise glides out.
out
The airlock hatch chimes quietly.
[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a rug
woven of large dark green fern fronds, a glossy seashell pink ceramic felo chow
bowl, a luxuriously soft oval amethyst rug with a gold fleur-de-lys in the
center and thick gold fringe, and a personal hoverpallet here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
out
You exit the ship.
[Asteroid Belt Management Station]
The four-person mule "Liberator", the one-person runabout "Faster", the
two-person medium transport "Grey Sky", the scout "Pathseeker", the vostok-class
capsule "Bolt", and the five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" are
parked here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go nowhere.

enter dove
[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a rug
woven of large dark green fern fronds, a glossy seashell pink ceramic felo chow
bowl, a luxuriously soft oval amethyst rug with a gold fleur-de-lys in the
center and thick gold fringe, and a personal hoverpallet here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
enter dove
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
purple photocopier, an insulated green cooler, a clear plastic food storage
container, a compact red refrigerator, and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go south and out.
sit couch
You sit down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it.

white and sapphire star quilt on it.

grin
You grin.
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
Once a waystation between Old Earth and its newly settled colony, the Colonial
Gate station is now largely irrelevant, but still stands guard here as a sort of
watchtower.
The Centauri Colony remains Old Earth's only remaining major extrasolar
possession. The planet does not appear to be particularly teeming with life,
with the color of the land fading from brownish grasses to grey bedrock.
Via general sector communication, Centauri transmits, "Greetings, William Dove!
Welcome to Centauri Colony Orbit!"
The computer reports that the two-person light corvette "League Navy Assault
Corvette Kestrel-88" has jumped into the sector.
The computer reports that the two-person light corvette "League Navy Assault
Corvette Kestrel-39" has jumped into the sector.

Assault Corvette Kestrel-88! Welcome to home space!"
Via general sector communication, Centauri transmits, "Hello there, League Navy
Assault Corvette Kestrel-39! Welcome to home space!"

Corvette Kestrel-88" has landed on the planet Centauri.
You notice Lily Kaise using the radio to ask for landing clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "We detect you to be an AEU ship,
William Dove. The League welcomes you under the non-aggression pact."
Lily Kaise picks up a compact red refrigerator.

leaving you in a dim silence.

peer n
You peer north...
[Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay]
The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking
bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly
seamless walls and floor are constructed of light gray metal with signs and
hatchways accented in dark green. Though few people are about, it seems a very
well built and maintained station.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
You can go north, northeast, south, northwest, and up.
Repair Platform has been constructed.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark purple tee with a large neon purple dragon
appliqued on the front, a pair of faded blue jeans, and a pair of mystic purple
suede clogs. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet
around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her
wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved
with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst
crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced
plastic phone holster, a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria',
and a Tardick lizard named Asteria perched on her shoulder. Her head, face, both
eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.

enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.

appliqued on the front, a pair of faded blue jeans, and a pair of mystic purple
suede clogs. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet
around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her

right hand, and a large crystal gold-trimmed goblet of Cape Myers Paradise
Vineyards Pinot Grigio in her left hand.
